title: A Salon in the Palazzo Satriano, Naples
provenance:
Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Hazlitt, Gooden & Fox, London (label in Thaw files)

"Vex D47/8, Mr. E.V. Thaw" handwritten on label from back of frame.
medium: Brush and watercolor over graphite on white wove paper
description: In this plainly decorated salon, a marble (or marbleized) dado is topped by a floral border which runs around the painted pale green walls. The frieze around the ceiling, done either in plaster or trompe l'oeil, echoes the swags of the simple white curtains. A crystal chandelier in Neo-Classic style hangs over a marble-topped round table. An enfilade of rooms is seen through the open door of the salon just off-center on the right. On the walls are engravings after contemporary paintings, including Death of a Christian Martyr by Paul Delaroche.
name: Drawing
